p: Untreated control showed the highest percentage of rotten fruit in both trials. The pathogens isolated from rotten fruit were identified using morphological and molecular tools. On nectarines, the postharvest pathogens isolated from untreated fruit were Monilinia fructicola, Botrytis cinerea, and Alternaria spp. ( Table 1), with an incidence of 10.7%, 8.0% and 4.6%, respectively.
